intro: Polygala vulgaris var. insubrica, commonly known as the common milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, often branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The plant is adapted to well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas.
